availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Phillip Edward Latham (Mason County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, farmer. Mason County native. Son of Samuel Latham and Mary Latham. Married to Martha Thomas Latham in Mason County on November 3, 1852. Father of Mary F. Latham and Henry R. Latham. Farmhand in Mason County in 1850. Resident of Mason County in 1861. Farmer in Mason County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 1, p. 4A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Murphysville, Enumeration District 073, p. 5A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film 994027-994058: Mason County Marriages, p. 3 of 40 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Mason County, KY, September 1863, p. 3 of 212 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA,Film 7016159: All Counties, Mason County 1913, File #31128, p. 1338 of 3316 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, “Edward Latham (1833-1913)," Memorial # 193751378, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/193751378/edward-latham (accessed December 1, 2020).
KYR-0001-020-1529.
